system.description:
This is a unique Ancestry in that it doesnt have ANY Default Traits. Instead, Beastborn get access to a category of Expanded Traits called Beast Traits. You can spend your Ancestry Points on any of the Beast Traits below.

Beastborn Origin

Choose a type of Beast you are modeled after, such as a frog, elephant, lion, spider, rabbit, dog, or something else. Youre a Humanoid creature with an appearance based on the chosen Beast.

You gain the following Ancestry Trait:

@UUID[Compendium.dc20rpg.ancestries.Item.X8caTHh2OHvbGDmW]{(0) Beastkind}

Beast Traits

Below is a list of Beast Traits. You can only choose a Beast Trait once unless it says otherwise.

Senses

X8caTHh2OHvbGDmW.name: Beastkind
X8caTHh2OHvbGDmW.description:
You can understand and speak to (in a limited capacity) the species of Beast your Beastborn is modeled after.

You can understand the meaning of their noises and behaviors, and they understand the meanings of simple words, concepts, or states of emotion.

hGl8EZChOKQHrkrV.name: Echolocation
hGl8EZChOKQHrkrV.description:
You can spend 1 AP to roar, scream, or screech to gain Blindsight in a 10 Space radius that lasts until the start of your next turn.

The sound can be heard from up to 100 Spaces away. You gain no benefit from this Trait in an area of Silence.

tYmCldvZLzDEat38.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
tYmCldvZLzDEat38.description: While you or your target is in sunlight, you have DisADV on Attacks and Awareness Checks that rely on sight.

nOnUPiDavPK29OrC.name: Climb Speed
nOnUPiDavPK29OrC.description: You gain a Climb Speed equal to your Movement Speed.

WWCGEMvgnLdPB8BJ.name: Spider Climb
WWCGEMvgnLdPB8BJ.description:
Requires Climb Speed.

You can walk normally without falling or needing to Climb along vertical surfaces and upside down (such as on ceilings).

X44OFWhuXNPPc3KI.name: Web Walk
X44OFWhuXNPPc3KI.description:
You can walk along and through webs unimpeded.

Additionally, you know the location of any creature thats in contact with the same web.

Hl70VSX19e41cqf7.name: Swim Speed
Hl70VSX19e41cqf7.description: You gain a Swim Speed equal to your Ground Speed. Additionally, your Breath Duration increases by 3.

lOfjCgtv4ZqklF8A.name: Burrow Speed
lOfjCgtv4ZqklF8A.description: You gain a Burrow Speed equal to half your Movement Speed.

H40dF5hYMxP9LJDP.name: Charge
H40dF5hYMxP9LJDP.description: If you move at least 2 Spaces in a straight line before making a Melee Attack, the damage of the Attack increases by 1.

B8aDC3RXGkb76Rfj.name: Sprint
B8aDC3RXGkb76Rfj.description:
You can use your Minor Action to take the Move Action.

Once you use this Trait, you cant use it again until you take a turn without taking the Move Action.

Snk8RGLtXj7oohBc.name: Speed Increase
Snk8RGLtXj7oohBc.description: Your Speed increases by 1 Space.

3INz783QOrlK5WSI.name: Jumper
3INz783QOrlK5WSI.description: Your Jump Distance increases by 2, and you can take the Jump Action as a Minor Action.

7T3no5QMBnhmQSHt.name: Strong Jumper
7T3no5QMBnhmQSHt.description: You no longer need to move 2 Spaces before performing a Running Jump, and you take 0 damage from Controlled Falling 5 Spaces or less.

d2eHzeU0ZQ9y5UUV.name: Glide Speed
d2eHzeU0ZQ9y5UUV.description:
You have a set of wings that you can use to horizontally glide and slow your descent.

Provided you aren't Incapacitated you gain the following benefits while in the air:

  • Controlled Falling: You suffer no damage from Controlled Falling.
  • Altitude Drop: If you end your turn mid air, you controlled fall 4 Spaces.
  • Glide Speed: You can use your movement to glide horizontally.

8a6HPi0b0zTO0o9t.name: Limited Flight
8a6HPi0b0zTO0o9t.description:
Requires Glide Speed.

You have a set of wings that grant you limited flight.

Provided you aren't Incapacitated you gain the following benefits:

  • Vertical Ascent: : You can spend 2 Spaces of movement to ascend 1 Space vertically.
  • Hover: When you end your turn in the air, you maintain your altitude.

kdvC2n45FcQJereB.name: Full Flight
kdvC2n45FcQJereB.description:
Requires Limited Flight.

You have a Fly Speed equal to your Ground Speed.

a1kAdov8k4JxA0wb.name: Flyby
a1kAdov8k4JxA0wb.description:
Requires Limited Flight.

You dont provoke Opportunity Attacks when you Fly out of an enemy's reach.

FvUdJ1VlHtShIk70.name: Winged Arms
FvUdJ1VlHtShIk70.description:
Requires any Flying Beast Trait.

Your arms are also your wings. You cant hold anything in your hands when using a Glide Speed or Fly Speed.

Dwu3Mu6UVCyLmULQ.name: Thick-Skinned
Dwu3Mu6UVCyLmULQ.description: Your PD increases by 1 while youre not wearing Heavy Armor.

7IttzE2JpQCyzhDN.name: Natural Armor
7IttzE2JpQCyzhDN.description:
Requires Thick-Skinned.

While not wearing Heavy Armor, you gain +1 Physical Damage Reduction.

wsdzsPxMpRjSU5h5.name: Hard Shell
wsdzsPxMpRjSU5h5.description:
Requires Thick-Skinned.

You have a large shell around your body for protection. Your PD increases by 1 (while youre not wearing Heavy Armor), your Movement Speed decreases by 1, and youre immune to being Flanked.

mr2COYe6LSE1QjRW.name: Shell Retreat
mr2COYe6LSE1QjRW.description:
Requires Hard Shell.

Your body has a shell that you can retreat into.

You can spend 1 AP to retreat into or come back out of your shell.

While in your shell, you gain +5 PD, Resistance (Half) to Physical and Elemental damage, and ADV on Might Saves.

Youre also Prone, you cant move, you have DisADV on Agility Saves, and you cant take Reactions.

nUkdPwKAYecFuWoj.name: Powerful Build
nUkdPwKAYecFuWoj.description: You increase by 1 size, but you occupy the Space of a creature 1 size smaller.

crfYLAhDfW2GRY5b.name: Long-Limbed
crfYLAhDfW2GRY5b.description: When you make a Melee Martial Attack, your reach is 1 Space greater than normal.

HCTTPmz5EtWAEfL7.name: Secondary Arms
HCTTPmz5EtWAEfL7.description:
You have 2 slightly smaller secondary arms below your primary pair of arms.

They function just like your primary arms, but they cant wield Heavy Weapons or any Shields.

akPRP5LjzlZ6uGyL.name: Prehensile Appendage
akPRP5LjzlZ6uGyL.description:
You have a prehensile tail or trunk that has a reach of 1 Space and can lift up an amount of pounds equal to your Might times 5 (or half as many kilograms).

You can use it to lift, hold, or drop objects, and to push, pull, or grapple creatures.

It cant wield Weapons or Shields, you cant use tools with it that require manual precision, and you cant use it in place of Somatic Components for Spells.

q3mMR4ZvwPdBpoTa.name: Hazardous Hide
q3mMR4ZvwPdBpoTa.description:
You have spikes, retractable barbs, poisonous skin, or some other form of defense mechanism to keep creatures from touching you.

Choose 1 of the following damage types: Corrosion, Piercing, or Poison.

While you are Grappled, your Grappler takes 1 damage of the chosen type at the start of each of its turns.

Creatures that start their turn Grappled by you also take this damage.

EvAEBMpXy5gMCEiN.name: Camouflage
EvAEBMpXy5gMCEiN.description:
You can change the color and pattern of your body.

While motionless you have ADV on Stealth Checks.

3R1g1StldfHjaV2W.name: Fire Resistance
3R1g1StldfHjaV2W.description: You have Fire Resistance (Half) and ADV on Saves against Exhaustion from hot temperatures.

eWl1wPWvINUQTHGN.name: Cold Resistance
eWl1wPWvINUQTHGN.description: You have Cold Resistance (Half) and ADV on Saves against Exhaustion from cold temperatures.

UdnEYejDT3prwjzj.name: Short Legged
UdnEYejDT3prwjzj.description: Your Speed decreases by 1 Space.

xsHMqu8vGj0oaKP3.name: Fast Reflexes
xsHMqu8vGj0oaKP3.description: You gain ADV on Initiative Checks and on the first Attack Check you make in Combat.

NrCWkVALzlddbBHz.name: Mimicry
NrCWkVALzlddbBHz.description:
You can mimic simple sounds that you have heard (such as a babys crying, the creak of a door, or single words) and repeat short 3 word phrases that sound identical to what you heard.

A creature can make an Insight Check contested by your Trickery Check to determine if this sound is real.

KfZDpmhY6MpleWHz.name: Intimidating Shout
KfZDpmhY6MpleWHz.description:
Once per Combat, you can spend 1 AP to let out an Intimidating Shout.

All creatures within 5 Spaces that can hear you must make a Charisma Save contested by your Attack Check.

Failure: A target is Hindered on the next Attack Check or Spell Attack it makes before the start of your next turn.

sCyXbLIvif61ElvF.name: Toxic Constitution
sCyXbLIvif61ElvF.description: You have Poison Resistance (Half) and ADV on Saves against being Poisoned.

1NUY0dgFR36Ck2SC.name: Shoot Webs
1NUY0dgFR36Ck2SC.description:
You can spend 1 AP to make a Ranged Attack Check against a target within 5 Spaces.

The target makes a Physical Save contested by your Attack Check.

Save Failure: The target is Restrained by webbing and can spend 1 AP on their turn to attempt to escape (Martial Check vs your Save DC).

The webbing can also be attacked and destroyed (PD 10; 2 HP; Immunity to Bludgeoning, Poison, and Psychic damage).

dKbustTYVPy53Jnf.name: Natural Weapon
dKbustTYVPy53Jnf.description: You have up to 2 Natural Weapons (claws, horns, fangs, tail, etc) which you can use to make Unarmed Strikes that deal 1 Bludgeoning, Piercing, or Slashing damage (your choice upon gaining this Trait).

ZPAo8av6TrUGPB6X.name: Natural Projectile
ZPAo8av6TrUGPB6X.description:
Requires Natural Weapon.

You can use your Natural Weapon to make a Ranged Martial Attack with a Range of 10 Spaces. The Natural Weapon might produce a spine, barb, fluid, or other harmful projectile (your choice).

x9iHhn5bMFdl2UHu.name: Natural Weapon Passive
x9iHhn5bMFdl2UHu.description:
Requires Natural Weapon.

You can choose 1 Weapon Style that fits your desired Natural Weapon. You can benefit from the chosen Weapon Style with your Natural Weapon.

xILEf8R8nv4f0RL2.name: Rend
xILEf8R8nv4f0RL2.description:
Requires Natural Weapon.

You can spend 1 AP when making an Attack Check with your Natural Weapon to force the target to make a Physical Save.

Failure: The target begins Bleeding.

m8VXey0D6qBbe2jj.name: Retractable Natural Weapon
m8VXey0D6qBbe2jj.description:
Requires Natural Weapon.

Your Natural Weapon is able to be concealed or retracted and gains the Concealed Property (gain ADV the first Attack Check you make in Combat).

xNIuY70IAwnsIkIu.name: Venomous Natural Weapon
xNIuY70IAwnsIkIu.description:
Requires Natural Weapon.

When you Hit a creature with your Natural Weapon, they make a Physical Save against your Save DC.

Failure: The target becomes Impaired until the start of your next turn.

CfFzNdUfy4DRnMC1.name: Keen Sense (Hearing)
CfFzNdUfy4DRnMC1.description:
You make Awareness Checks with ADV using Hearing.

You can choose this trait multiple times, choosing a different sense each time.

DM9AxReTEaNUqFer.name: Keen Sense (Sight)
DM9AxReTEaNUqFer.description:
You make Awareness Checks with ADV using Sight.

You can choose this trait multiple times, choosing a different sense each time.

h05dvrNoT3b9OqsQ.name: Keen Sense (Smell)
h05dvrNoT3b9OqsQ.description:
You make Awareness Checks with ADV using Smell.

You can choose this trait multiple times, choosing a different sense each time.

hGl8EZChOKQHrkrV.description:
You can spend 1 AP to roar, scream, or screech to gain Blindsight in a 10 Space radius that lasts until the start of your next turn.

The sound can be heard from up to 100 Spaces away. You gain no benefit from this Trait in an area of Silence.

q3mMR4ZvwPdBpoTa.description:
You have spikes, retractable barbs, poisonous skin, or some other form of defense mechanism to keep creatures from touching you.

Choose 1 of the following damage types: Corrosion, Piercing, or Poison.

While you are Grappled, your Grappler takes 1 damage of the chosen type at the start of each of its turns.

Creatures that start their turn Grappled by you also take this damage.

EvAEBMpXy5gMCEiN.name: Camouflage
EvAEBMpXy5gMCEiN.description:
You can change the color and pattern of your body.

While motionless you have ADV on Stealth Checks.

3R1g1StldfHjaV2W.name: Fire Resistance
3R1g1StldfHjaV2W.description: You have Fire Resistance (Half) and ADV on Saves against Exhaustion from hot temperatures.

eWl1wPWvINUQTHGN.name: Cold Resistance
eWl1wPWvINUQTHGN.description: You have Cold Resistance (Half) and ADV on Saves against Exhaustion from cold temperatures.

UdnEYejDT3prwjzj.name: Short Legged
UdnEYejDT3prwjzj.description: Your Speed decreases by 1 Space.

xsHMqu8vGj0oaKP3.name: Fast Reflexes
xsHMqu8vGj0oaKP3.description: You gain ADV on Initiative Checks and on the first Attack Check you make in Combat.

NrCWkVALzlddbBHz.name: Mimicry
NrCWkVALzlddbBHz.description:
You can mimic simple sounds that you have heard (such as a babys crying, the creak of a door, or single words) and repeat short 3 word phrases that sound identical to what you heard.

A creature can make an Insight Check contested by your Trickery Check to determine if this sound is real.

KfZDpmhY6MpleWHz.name: Intimidating Shout
KfZDpmhY6MpleWHz.description:
Once per Combat, you can spend 1 AP to let out an Intimidating Shout.

All creatures within 5 Spaces that can hear you must make a Charisma Save contested by your Attack Check.

Failure: A target is Hindered on the next Attack Check or Spell Attack it makes before the start of your next turn.

sCyXbLIvif61ElvF.name: Toxic Constitution
sCyXbLIvif61ElvF.description: You have Poison Resistance (Half) and ADV on Saves against being Poisoned.

1NUY0dgFR36Ck2SC.name: Shoot Webs
1NUY0dgFR36Ck2SC.description:
You can spend 1 AP to make a Ranged Attack Check against a target within 5 Spaces.

The target makes a Physical Save contested by your Attack Check.

Save Failure: The target is Restrained by webbing and can spend 1 AP on their turn to attempt to escape (Martial Check vs your Save DC).

The webbing can also be attacked and destroyed (PD 10; 2 HP; Immunity to Bludgeoning, Poison, and Psychic damage).

ZPAo8av6TrUGPB6X.name: Natural Projectile
ZPAo8av6TrUGPB6X.description:
Requires Natural Weapon.

You can use your Natural Weapon to make a Ranged Martial Attack with a Range of 10 Spaces. The Natural Weapon might produce a spine, barb, fluid, or other harmful projectile (your choice).

m8VXey0D6qBbe2jj.name: Retractable Natural Weapon
m8VXey0D6qBbe2jj.description:
Requires Natural Weapon.

Your Natural Weapon is able to be concealed or retracted and gains the Concealed Property (gain ADV the first Attack Check you make in Combat).

xNIuY70IAwnsIkIu.name: Venomous Natural Weapon
xNIuY70IAwnsIkIu.description:
Requires Natural Weapon.

When you Hit a creature with your Natural Weapon, they make a Physical Save against your Save DC.

Failure: The target becomes Impaired until the start of your next turn.

CfFzNdUfy4DRnMC1.name: Keen Sense (Hearing)
CfFzNdUfy4DRnMC1.description:
You make Awareness Checks with ADV using Hearing.

You can choose this trait multiple times, choosing a different sense each time.

DM9AxReTEaNUqFer.name: Keen Sense (Sight)
DM9AxReTEaNUqFer.description:
You make Awareness Checks with ADV using Sight.

You can choose this trait multiple times, choosing a different sense each time.

h05dvrNoT3b9OqsQ.name: Keen Sense (Smell)
h05dvrNoT3b9OqsQ.description:
You make Awareness Checks with ADV using Smell.

You can choose this trait multiple times, choosing a different sense each time.

system.description:
You can understand and speak to (in a limited capacity) the species of Beast your Beastborn is modeled after.

You can understand the meaning of their noises and behaviors, and they understand the meanings of simple words, concepts, or states of emotion.

System Tip: Style Passive of that weapon is unique and cannot be automated right now. If you want to benefit from it drop @UUID[Compendium.dc20rpg.techniques.Item.KUMM85xa1Sea4JtZ]{Crossbow Style} on your character sheet.

Hunters are expert hunters, master survivalists, and natural explorers. They mark their targets to better track and kill them with their use of terrain, traps and weapons.

Source of Power: Rangers use their experience and knowledge of the dangers of nature and the creatures that live within it. They can adapt to all sorts of environments and use what they learn to their advantage.

Starting Equipment

  • 2 Weapons or Light Shields
  • 1 Ranged Weapon with 20 Ammo OR 3 Weapons with the Toss or Thrown Property
  • 1 set of Novice Light Armor
  • X or Y Packs (Adventuring Packs Coming Soon)

Hunter Martial Mastery

Combat Training: Weapons, Light Shields, Light Armor

Maneuvers: You learn all Attack Maneuvers. You learn additional Maneuvers as shown in the Maneuvers Known column of the Class Table.

Techniques: The number of Techniques you know increases as shown in the Techniques Known column of the Class Table.

Stamina Points:Your maximum number of Stamina Points increases as shown in the Stamina Points column of the Class Table.

Stamina Regen: @UUID[Compendium.dc20rpg.classes.Item.dzgOIH8OgQBq5ahb]{Stamina Regen (Hunter)}

Class Features

Level 1 Class Features

@UUID[Compendium.dc20rpg.classes.Item.KOyujvqMWaml4ugE]{Hunter's Mark}

@UUID[Compendium.dc20rpg.classes.Item.DOAsuEgxq694ibIj]{Favored Terrain}

@UUID[Compendium.dc20rpg.classes.Item.2WAgXjsngJ1xjbdy]{Hunter Bestiary (Flavor Feature)}

Level 2 Class Features

@UUID[Compendium.dc20rpg.classes.Item.eu0sQyynPGSuLRiy]{Hunters Strike}

TALENT

DOAsuEgxq694ibIj.name: Favored Terrain
DOAsuEgxq694ibIj.description:
You are particularly familiar with two types of environments and are adept at the skills unique to the region. Choose 2 types of Favored Terrain listed below.

  • Coast

  • Desert

  • Forest

  • Grassland

  • Jungle

  • Mountain

  • Subterranean

  • Swamp

  • Tundra

  • Urban

Additionally, while youre in one of your Favored Terrains, you have ADV on Stealth and Survival Checks and cant be Surprised.

dzgOIH8OgQBq5ahb.name: Hunter Stamina
dzgOIH8OgQBq5ahb.description:
Once per round, you can regain up to half your maximum SP when:

  • When you Hit the target of your Hunters Mark with a Martial Attack.

  • The target of your Hunters Mark is reduced to 0 HP or dies.

  • You succeed on a Check to recall information about a creature.

  • You succeed on a Check to locate an Unseen creature.

KOyujvqMWaml4ugE.name: Hunter's Mark
KOyujvqMWaml4ugE.description:
You can spend 1 AP and 1 SP to focus on and mark a creature you can see within 15 Spaces as your quarry. Alternatively, you can mark a creature by studying its tracks for at least 1 minute.

While a creature is marked, you gain the following benefits:

  • You have ADV on Awareness and Survival Checks made to find the target.

  • The first Martial Attack against your target on your turn has ADV and ignores PDR.

  • When you score a Heavy or Critical Hit on the target, you automatically grant a Help Die (d8) to the next Attack made against the target before the start of your next turn. 

The target is marked as long as it's on the same Plane of Existence as you, and vanishes early if you complete a Long Rest, fall Unconscious, or use this Feature again to mark another creature.

2WAgXjsngJ1xjbdy.name: Hunter Bestiary (Flavor Feature)
2WAgXjsngJ1xjbdy.description:
You have developed a trove of knowledge hunting creatures which youve recorded in your Bestiary. Your Bestiary can take the form of a book or a memory vault within your mind.

You have ADV on Checks made to learn or recall information about any creature recorded in your Bestiary.

Starting Entries: Choose a Creature Type: Aberration, Beast, Celestial, Construct, Dragon, Elemental, Fey, Fiend, Giant, Humanoid, Monstrosity, Ooze, Plant, or Undead. Your Bestiary includes pre-recorded notes about various creatures of the chosen type.

Making New Entries: You can spend 10 minutes of Light Activity recording information into your Bestiary about a specific creature you have slain within the last 24 hours.

W5MfgTRiV93l3JK4.name: Coast
W5MfgTRiV93l3JK4.description:
• You gain a Swim Speed equal to your Speed.

  • Your Attack Checks no longer have DisADV as a result of being underwater. 

  • You can hold your breath twice as long as normal. 

  • You have ADV on Awareness Checks while underwater.

kl4h5EPweDxKga01.name: Desert
kl4h5EPweDxKga01.description:
• You gain Fire Resistance (Half)

  • You have ADV on Saves against Resistance to Exhaustion from hot temperatures.

6Qy92FQGwisBOVkn.name: Forest
6Qy92FQGwisBOVkn.description: • You gain 1 Skill Point in 2 of the following Skills: Animal, Awareness, Medicine, Survival, and Stealth.

myRHx8fzNN6Vn0yv.name: Grassland
myRHx8fzNN6Vn0yv.description: • Your Speed and Jump Distance increases by 1.

Tl9R9SJu5gsTYBz5.name: Jungle
Tl9R9SJu5gsTYBz5.description: • You ignore Difficult Terrain and gain Resistance to Poisoned and ADV on Saves against against being contracting Diseases.

MxMRD97rl3m4UDIA.name: Mountain
MxMRD97rl3m4UDIA.description:
• You gain a Climb Speed equal to your Speed.

  • You have Resistance to Exhaustion from high altitudes.

  • You gain Resistance to damage from Falling.

35IlJSlIJvtnQbWD.name: Subterranean
35IlJSlIJvtnQbWD.description:
• You gain Darkvision 10 Spaces. If you already have Darkvision, its range is increased by 5 Spaces.
  • You also gain a Tremorsense of 3 Spaces. If you already have a Tremorsense, it increases by 2 Spaces.

XNgm5AbQpYVZ6Idg.name: Swamp
XNgm5AbQpYVZ6Idg.description:
• You gain Poison Resistance (Half).

  • You gain Resistance to Poisoned and ADV on Saves against against being contracting Diseases.

SS5jgCwWAugrdSiN.name: Tundra
SS5jgCwWAugrdSiN.description:
• You gain Cold Resistance (Half)

  • You have Resistance to Exhaustion from cold temperatures.

NXRl0oqdzjzQSoqL.name: Urban
NXRl0oqdzjzQSoqL.description: • You gain 1 Skill Point in 2 of the following Skills: Influence, Insight, Investigation, Intimidation and Trickery.

qrkBxXBYqdsd7rUt.name: Extend Attack
qrkBxXBYqdsd7rUt.description: Your Melee Attack Range is increased by 1 Space (or your Ranged Attack Range is increased by 5 Spaces) for the Attack Check.

UZMUmBv5E3RQGFlx.name: Power Attack
UZMUmBv5E3RQGFlx.description: You deal +1 damage with the Attack. You can use this Maneuver multiple times.

2iRK0FdWRvCPH44g.name: Sweep Attack
2iRK0FdWRvCPH44g.description:
Choose 1 additional target within 1 Space of the original target thats within your Attack Range.

Make 1 Attack Check against all targets.

Attack Hit: The original target takes your Weapon (or Unarmed Strike) damage, and each additional target Hit takes 1 damage of the same type.

You can use this Maneuver multiple times.

System Tip: Damage type is set to Slashing by default.

MQpSMP9FRuH9d4oQ.name: Chained Style
MQpSMP9FRuH9d4oQ.description:
Requirement: Weapons Combat Training

Your Attacks ignore Shields and 1/2 Cover, and you deal +1 damage against targets that are wielding a Shield or behind 1/2 Cover.

KUMM85xa1Sea4JtZ.name: Crossbow Style
KUMM85xa1Sea4JtZ.description:
Requirement: Weapons Combat Training

You deal +1 damage against the last creature you Attacked with the Weapon since the start of your last turn.

8p8PHs5ddM3ia69L.name: Spear Style
8p8PHs5ddM3ia69L.description:
Requirement: Weapons Combat Training

You deal +1 damage against a creature if you moved 2 Spaces towards it immediately before making the Attack or if it is on a Mount.

RaLHWY6CsDzghUNt.name: Whip Style
RaLHWY6CsDzghUNt.description:
Requirement: Weapons Combat Training

You deal +1 damage with Melee Attacks against creatures that are farther than 1 Space from you.

6JGmfeR778ZnMQox.name: Bleed
6JGmfeR778ZnMQox.description:
Save Enhancement: Target makes Physical Save against the chosen effect. If you spend AP on multiple effects, the enemy creature will only make 1 Save against all effects.

Save Fail: The target begins Bleeding.

I43SgvhCmvjLQb5v.name: Body Block
I43SgvhCmvjLQb5v.description:
Trigger: You are targeted by an Attack.

Reaction: You reposition a creature Grappled by you to shield yourself from damage.

You and the Grappled creature take half the damage dealt by the attack and you can move the Grappled creature to any space adjacent to you immediately afterwards.

 

Grapple Maneuver:

When you attempt to Grapple a creature, you can spend additional AP to perform a Grapple Maneuver as part of the Grapple attempt. You must choose to do so before you make the Grapple Check.

  • Grapple Success: The target is Grappled and suffers the damage or effects of your Maneuver.

You can also perform Grapple Maneuvers on creatures you have Grappled. When you perform a Grapple Maneuver against a creature you have Grappled, you make an Athletics Check Contested by the targets Martial Check.

  • Contest Success: The target suffers the damage or effects of your maneuver.

  • Contest Failure: The target suffers no additional effects but remains Grappled by you.

1dDDAMaCCYzWlN8Z.name: Daze
1dDDAMaCCYzWlN8Z.description:
Save Enhancement: Target makes Physical Save against the chosen effect. If you spend AP on multiple effects, the enemy creature will only make 1 Save against all effects.

Save Fail: The target becomes Dazed on the next Mental Check it makes before the end of your next turn.

2q82GqvMW0gQGV8b.name: Expose
2q82GqvMW0gQGV8b.description:
Save Enhancement: Target makes Physical Save against the chosen effect. If you spend AP on multiple effects, the enemy creature will only make 1 Save against all effects.

Save Fail: The target becomes Exposed X against the next Attack Check made against it before the end of your next turn.

ZNyQPlISpJwaPXtb.name: Spend Stamina instead of AP
ZNyQPlISpJwaPXtb.description: You can spend SP in place of Action Points when performing a Martial Maneuver.

zyVf455HBJntEEyS.command:
const maxStamina = actor.system.resources.stamina.max || 0;
game.dc20rpg.resources.regainBasicResource("stamina", actor, Math.ceil(maxStamina/2), true);
zyVf455HBJntEEyS.name: Regain Stamina

WzJNfQVTpdDyjgU1.name: onDemand
WzJNfQVTpdDyjgU1.command:
game.dc20rpg.tools.prepareHelpAction(actor, {diceValue: 8})
game.dc20rpg.tools.getSimplePopup("info", {header: "Help Dice Ready", information:[`The d8 Help Dice was added to ${actor.name}. Remember to use it on the next Attack made against marked target`]});

system.description: You can spend 1 AP to make 1 Attack Check.

You can spend 1 AP to make an Attack Check Contested by the target's Athletics, Acrobatics, or Trickery Check (targets choice).

The target has ADV if theyre holding the object with 2 hands. You have DisADV if the target is larger than you. You cant Disarm a creature thats 2 Sizes larger than you.

Success: The targeted object falls into an unoccupied space of your choice within 1 Space of the creature.

system.description:
Using a free hand, you can spend 1 AP to attempt to Grapple another creature within 1 Space.

Make an Athletics Check contested by the opposing creatures Martial Check.

You or the target may have ADV or DisADV on your Check based on each others size (see @UUID[Compendium.dc20rpg.rules.JournalEntry.HNPA8Fd7ynirYUBq.JournalEntryPage.ae17b973b3872de1]{Moving & Grappling Creatures}).

Success: The creature is Grappled by you.

  • Dragging: You can move the target to any Space adjacent to you by spending your own Movement to do so. Alternatively, when you move, you can move the target with you, but youre considered Slowed (Every 1 Space you move costs an extra 1 Space of movement).

  • Ending a Grapple Escape Grapple: The target can spend 1 AP to attempt to free itself from a Grapple. You must make an Athletics Check contested by the targets Martial Check.

    Failure: The Grapple immediately ends.

  • Incapacitated Grappler: If you become Incapacitated, the Grapple immediately ends.

  • Forced Movement: If an effect attempts to forcibly move the target beyond your reach, you make the Check or Save instead of the target. If the effect targets both you and the target, you make 1 Check or Save for both of you.

    Success: The targets of the effect arent moved.

    Failure: The Grapple immediately ends, and the targets of the effect are moved.

  • Falling: If the target begins falling (and you dont), the Grapple ends if you cant carry the targets weight. If you can carry its weight, you hold it suspended in the air.

You can spend 1 AP to attempt to push a creature within 1 Space of you. Make an Athletics Check contested by the targets Martial Check.

Success: You push the creature 1 Space away from you or to its left or right.

Success (each 5): Push up to 1 additional Space.

Knock Prone: After the result, you can choose to reduce the total distance the target is pushed by 1 Space to knock them Prone instead.

If you move at least 2 Spaces in a straight line, you can spend 1 AP to attempt to Tackle a creature thats your size or smaller.

Make an Athletics Check contested by the target's Martial Check.

Success: You Grapple the target and you both move 1 Space in the same direction you were moving then immediately fall Prone.

Success (each 5): +1 Space moved.
You can spend 1 AP to impose DisADV on Opportunity Attacks made against you until the start of your next turn.

effects.name: Disengage
effects.description: You impose DisADV on Opportunity Attacks made against you until the start of your next turn.

system.description: You can spend 2 AP to become immune to Opportunity Attacks until the start of your next turn.

effects.name: Full Disengage
effects.description: You are immune to Opportunity Attacks until the start of your next turn.

system.description: You can spend 1 AP to impose DisADV on the next Attack or Grapple made against you before the start of your next turn.

effects.name: Dodge
effects.description: You impose DisADV on the next Attack or Grapple made against you before the start of your next turn.

system.description: You can spend 2 AP to impose DisADV on all Attacks or Grapples made against you until the start of your next turn.

effects.name: Full Dodge
effects.description: You impose DisADV on all Attacks or Grapples made against you until the start of your next turn.

system.description:
You can spend 1 AP to attempt to Hide from 1 or more creatures that cant see you (Unseen).

Make a Stealth Check against the opposing creature(s) Passive Awareness.

Success: You become Hidden from creatures whose Passive Awareness you beat (making you Unseen and Unheard by them).

You remain Hidden until you make a noise louder than a whisper, make an Attack, cast a Spell with a Verbal Component, or a creature takes the Search Action and successfully locates you.

See @UUID[Compendium.dc20rpg.rules.JournalEntry.HNPA8Fd7ynirYUBq.JournalEntryPage.a0d67820b3677829]{Hidden Creatures} (@UUID[Compendium.dc20rpg.rules.JournalEntry.HNPA8Fd7ynirYUBq.JournalEntryPage.6396da38cde5e264]{Unseen}, @UUID[Compendium.dc20rpg.rules.JournalEntry.HNPA8Fd7ynirYUBq.JournalEntryPage.8c1b9e075707a2ce]{Unheard}, @UUID[Compendium.dc20rpg.rules.JournalEntry.HNPA8Fd7ynirYUBq.JournalEntryPage.38850187f9364dd3]{Hidden}) for more on hiding.

When you take the Hide Action and beat an enemys Passive Awareness, you only become Hidden from that creature because it cant see or hear you (youre both Unseen and Unheard). However, if your Stealth Check beats one enemys Awareness Score but not anothers, then youre Hidden from the first enemy, but youre not Hidden from the second enemy.

effects.name: Hidden
effects.description: You become Hidden from creatures whose Passive Awareness you beat.

system.description:
You can spend 1 AP to move up to your Speed in Spaces (default of 5).

You choose where to move, and can break up your movement by moving before and after taking a different Action.

You cant end your turn in a Space occupied by another creature.

A creature with 4 AP can take the Move Action to move 1 Space, take the Attack Action, move 1 Space again (2 total Spaces), take the Attack Action again, and then move 2 Spaces again (4 total Spaces).

system.description:
You can spend 1 AP to grant another creature a d8 Help Die that lasts until the start of your next turn. Upon granting the Help Die, you must declare which creature youre Helping and the type of Check youll be aiding them with while meeting the following conditions:

  • Attack: You declare 1 target for the Attack. You must be within 1 Space of the Attacker or the target of the Attack. While the Help Die lasts, it can be added to an Attack made against the target.

  • Skill or Trade Check: You declare a type of Skill or Trade Check. You describe how youre Helping them and must do so with a Skill or Trade that you have at least 1 Mastery Level in. You can use the same Skill or Trade or a different one.

The Help Die can only be used to aid the type of Check declared and disappears once it is used.

Multiple Help Penalty: Once you take the Help Action, each time you take the Help Action again before the end of your turn, your Help Die decays by 1 step, to a minimum of a d4 (d8 | d6 | d4). These Help Dice only decay when using the Help Action. Help Die granted by other sources (such as the Sword Maneuver) decay independently of any Help Dice grant through the Help Action.

You can spend 1 AP to perform 1 of the following object interactions:

  • Drink a Potion or administer a Potion to another creature.

  • Attempt to lock or unlock a Lock.

  • Make a Trickery Check to activate or disable a trap or other mechanism.

  • Transfer an item to or from another creature (only 1 of the two creatures spends 1 AP).

  • Throw an item to a location you can see up to 5 Spaces away.
You can spend 1 or more AP to cast a Spell that you know. If the Spell has a Mana Point requirement, you must spend that much MP to cast the Spell.

You can spend 1 AP to attempt to recall or discern some information about a creature that you can see or hear. Make a DC 10KnowledgeCheck.

Success: You learn a piece of lore about the creature.

Success (each 5): You learn 1 creature statistic (PD, AD, Attacks, Abilities, Resistances, Vulnerabilities, Immunities, etc.).

You can spend 1 AP to attempt to beguile a Beast that can see or hear you. Make an Animal Check contested by the targets Charisma Save.

Success: The animal is Taunted by you for 1 minute (Repeated Save) or until you target it with a harmful Attack, Spell, or other effect.

Success (5): Its also Impaired.

Success (10): Its also Charmed.

system.description:
You can spend 1 AP to attempt to discern the course of actions a creature might take on its next turn.

Make an Insight Check contested by the targets Trickery or Influence Check (its choice).

Success: You learn the targets emotional state and whether it plans to make an Attack, cast a Spell, or flee combat during its next turn.

Success (5): You know who the creature is likely to target with a harmful ability.

Success (10): You know which ability the creature plans to use.

If the target is a PC, its player tells you what the creature plans to do. If the target is an NPC, the GM tells you what the creature plans to do.

You can spend 1 AP to attempt to hide an object on yourself or in nearby foliage, debris, or decor to render it Hidden.

Make a contested Trickery Check against the Passive Awareness of creatures that can see you.

Success: The object is Hidden from any creature whose Passive Awareness you beat.

You can spend 1 AP to make a Trickery Check Contested by the targets Insight Check.

Success: The next Attack against the target before the start of your next turn has ADV and deals +1 damage.

effects.name: Feint
effects.description: The next Attack against you has ADV and deals +1 damage.

system.description:
You can spend 1 AP to attempt to intimidate a creature that can see or hear you.

Make an Intimidation Check contested by the targets Charisma Save.

Success: The target is Intimidated by you until the end of your next turn.

You can spend 1 AP to attempt to uncover a concealed object on a creature, a secret compartment, or the intended function of a mechanism within 1 Space of you.

  • Concealed Objects: You can attempt to uncover any objects concealed on a creature.

    Make an Investigation Check contested by the targets Trickery Check.

    Success: You know the location of any concealed object on the creature.

  • Secret Compartments: You can attempt to uncover any secret compartments. Make an Investigation Check against the discovery DC of any secret compartments.

    Success: You discover the location of any secret compartments whose discovery DC you beat.

  • Discern Mechanism: You can attempt to discern the functionality of a mechanism (the effect of a trap, how to open a secret door, or activate a device). Make an Investigation Check.

    Success: You learn how the mechanism works and the methods to activate and disable it (if any).

You can spend 1 AP to attempt to increase the distance you can cover when Jumping. Make a DC 10 Martial Check.

  • Long Jump:

    • Success: You can move 1 additional Space as part of your Long Jump.

    • Success (each 5): +1 additional Space.

  • High Jump:

    • Success: You can move an additional 1ft (30cm) as part of your High Jump.

    • Success (each 5): +1ft (30cm).

You can spend 1 AP to touch a creature and tend to its wounds.

Make a DC 10 Medicine Check.

Success: You stop its Bleeding or Stabilize it (your choice).

Success (each 5): The creature gains +1 Temp HP.

You can spend 1 AP to maneuver a mount youre riding to avoid danger.

Make a DC 10 Animal Check.

Success: The mounts PD increases by 2 until the start of your next turn.

Success (5): +2 PD.

Success (10): +4 PD.

effects.name: Mounted Defense
effects.description: The mounts PD increases by 2 until the start of your next turn.

effects.name: Mounted Defense +2
effects.description: The mounts PD increases by 4 until the start of your next turn.

effects.name: Mounted Defense +4
effects.description: The mounts PD increases by 6 until the start of your next turn.

system.description:
You can spend 1 AP to attempt to move through a Space occupied by a hostile creature thats within 1 size of you.

Make a contested Martial Check against the target.

Success: You can move through the creatures Space as if it were Difficult Terrain (Slowed while moving through the area).

Success (5): You can move through the creature's space without it counting as Difficult Terrain.

You can spend 1 AP to attempt to locate 1 or more Hidden creatures and concealed objects within your Line of Sight.

  • Hidden Creatures: You attempt to locate any Hidden creatures in the area. Make an Awareness Check against the Stealth Check of any Hidden creatures.

    Success: You know the location of any Hidden creature whose Stealth Check you beat until the end of your turn. Knowing a creatures location does not grant you the ability to see it.

  • Hidden Objects: You attempt to locate any Hidden objects in the area. Make an Awareness Check against the DC to discover any concealed objects (such as traps, secret doors, or hidden items).

    Success: You discover the location of any Hidden object whose discovery DC you beat.

Without obstruction, a PCs line of sight could reach the horizon. You might ask your PC to make their Awareness Check with DisADV to detect a creature thats far away, such as beyond 10 Spaces.

Prerequisite: Martial Mastery

Trigger: A creature you can see within your Melee Range uses its movement to leave your Melee Range, draws a Weapon, picks an item up off the ground, or takes the Object Action.

Reaction: You can spend 1 AP to make a Melee Martial Attack against the provoking creature.

DC Tip: You can spend additional AP to gain ADV or to perform Maneuvers with the Attack.

Prerequisite: SpellcastingMastery

Trigger:When another creature that you can see casts a Spell.

Reaction: You declare a Spell Duel and spend 2 AP and 1 or more MP to challenge the creature with a Spell of your own.You can declare a Spell Duel after the creature makes its Spell Check but before you know the result of its Check.

Choosing a Spell

You declare which Spell youre using to challenge the opposing Spell, and then describe how you do so using your Spell. The GM decides if that makes sense.

  • Targeted: If your chosen Spell targets 1 or more creatures or objects, you must be able to target the opposing creature or any of its targets with your Spell.

  • Area of Effect: If your chosen Spell covers an area (such as an Arc, Cone, Cube, Cylinder, Line, or Sphere), then your Spells Area of Effect must include the opposing creature, any of its targets, or cover an area between the opposing creature and any of its targets.

  • Success & Failure: The success and failure statements of your Spell are replaced by the success and failure statements in the Contest section below.

Contest

The Spell Check the opposing creature makes to cast its Spell is Contested by the Spell Check you make to cast your Spell. When comparing the Spell Checks for the purpose of determining the winner of the Contest, each creature gains a bonus to its Check equal to the MP it spent on its Spell.

  • Success: The target creatures Spell fails and has no effect.

  • Failure: The target creatures Spell succeeds and takes effect

  • Tie: The target creatures Spell fails, has no effect, and you each roll on the @UUID[Compendium.dc20rpg.roll-tables.RollTable.HxkcpDT6pEOIfYUk]{Wild Magic}. The effect from the table lasts until the end of your next turn.

Whatever the result, each creature still spends all AP, MP, or other resources they spent to cast their Spell.

Multiple Participants: Additional creatures can choose to participate in helping the Spell take effect or participate in stopping the Spell from taking effect. If multiple creatures choose to participate in the Spell Duel, the participants are sorted into Initiators (those trying to help the Spell take effect) and Challengers (those trying to prevent the Spell from taking effect). During the Contest (see further below), every participant makes their Spell Check and the highest Initiator result is compared against the highest Challenger result to determine the outcom.
